basics.name: Marina Andreianova
basics.label: Political Scientist / Master of Art in Baltic Sea Region Studies

work.company: Baltic Region Healthy Cities Association (Turku, Finland)
work.summary: My involvement included the development of project application, participation in international study visits, execution of international health promoting projects.
highlights: Preparation and execution of international projects and applications

work.company: Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University (Kalinigrad, Russia)
work.summary: I participated in several international scientific projects. In addition I was involved in educational methodical complex development and sociological surveys.
highlights: Running field interviews for further analysis of collected data
Development and delivery of lectures to project actors
Document analysis (regional, federal and international mass media)
Active participation in study visits - developing collaboration and share of experience

work.company: NGO Centre Youth for Freedom of Speech (Kalinigrad, Russia)
work.summary: This position implied the realisation of a project developed by Charity Children's Fund 'Victoria' to support orphans. I worked as a project manager and contributed to project via team building and event development.
highlights: Preparatory workshop for potential volunteers: group activities, problem-solving tasks, and beneficiary-oriented behaviour
Development of website for volunteers and dissemination of necessary information among them
Invitation of guest lectures, dance teachers, photographers to hold various workshops for orphans

volunteer.summary: 'REAL/ VIRTUAL' is the launch of a 5 month programme of events which explore the boundaries of reality and virtuality. This festival featured exhibitions, installations, performances and workshops.

volunteer.organization: National Centre of Contemporary Arts (Kaliningrad, Russia)
volunteer.summary: The aim of Kaliningrad Branch of NCCA is to implement the state cultural policy on contemporary art through exhibition, collecting, information, education and research activities both in Russia and abroad.
highlights: Collecting material and data for the excursions

education.institution: Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University (Kaliningrad, Russia)
Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University (Kaliningrad, Russia)

awards.title: Erasmus Mundus Triple I Programme
awards.awarder: European Commission, The Education, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA)
awards.summary: Stipend covering academic year during Erasmus exchange

awards.title: Aurora - Towards Modern and Innovative Higher Education
awards.summary: Stipend covering 14 months of Masters degree

skills.name: Project implementation
keywords: searching for information and report writing

skills.name: Adaptability
